intro: Guapira marcano-bertii, commonly known as the Marcano-Bertii guapira, is a species native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
